Literature Review: Cystic Fibrosis Modulator Therapies have revolutionized the treatment of cystic fibrosis (CF), a genetic disorder that affects multiple organ systems. The introduction of CFTR modulator therapies has significantly improved the prognosis and quality of life for individuals with CF. These therapies target specific CFTR protein malformations resulting from individual genetic mutations, providing a more personalized approach to treatment.
